__data__.text: the other hand comes in handy when in the pursuit of a lofty goal you become one with the task in front of you which leads to the actualization of a meaningful goal Mii chiet mihi author of the best-selling book Flo and the Godfather of flow psychology describes flow as an autotelic activity autotelic derives from two Greek words Auto meaning self and Telos meaning goal it refers to a self-contained activity one that is done not with the expectation of some future benefit but simply because the doing itself is the reward the

goal it refers to a self-contained activity one that is done not with the expectation of some future benefit but simply because the doing itself is the reward the big problem with today's society seems to be that we just can't get the work done on top of that we're in the middle of a purpose crisis we lack meaning in our careers but don't know what to do about it the tasks are repetitive and endless because that's all we'

t know what to do about it the tasks are repetitive and endless because that's all we're skilled to do distractions are everywhere Which pull us away from what's important and worst of all we lack Clarity on what we want out of life dopamine is quite a popular topic these days for that reason dopamine plays a

crucial role in reaching the Flow State but it goes far beyond that too many people get stuck in a state of narrow-minded living all they know is go to school get a job scroll on their phones Chase material objects and never truly experiencing the depth that life has to offer that isn'

t a way to live but what if I told you that you can find enjoyment in the boring mundane or terrible aspects of of your life even further what if I told you that you could use the flow state to achieve the meaningful goals you've been putting off in 6 months rather than 6 years the result of understanding flow is discovering your life'

ve been putting off in 6 months rather than 6 years the result of understanding flow is discovering your life's work having a sense of passion for that work and having tools to navigate the dreaded anxiety and overwhelm that cause most people to spiral into chaos life enjoyment isn't dictated by Randomness or luck it's created by deconstructing life as the game it is and learning how to

play I used to play a game that consumed far too much of my life it was called World of Warcraft and if you played it before I'm sure you're familiar with the late nights and Dungeons and raids and grinding out quests and farming and all of that fun stuff so you're welcome for the Nostalgia but for those who aren'

re welcome for the Nostalgia but for those who aren't familiar World of Warcraft is an MMO RPG or massive multiplayer online roleplaying game and I often found this game more exciting than the actual real world that we live in at night after coming home from my part-time job as a lifeguard over the summer I'

d put on my headphones and get immersed in the online world nothing else mattered but my mind and the lines of code that kept It Sane when you first log in as a beginner you're met with a series of tasks first you choose a faction then race then class and customize how your character looks there were two factions Alliance and horde many players were passionate and rather ideological about the faction they chose I played Alliance

but always thought the digital religion was a bit too much so I didn't necessarily hate the other side I just thought the characters looked a bit funny most of my characters were either humans or night elves but you could choose anything from gnomes to Orcs to pandarin which is like Panda people I guess to the undead the class you choose determines much of what you do throughout the game a class is your role and play style you can play the role of tank healer or damage when you and others complete quests dungeons or raids

throughout the game a class is your role and play style you can play the role of tank healer or damage when you and others complete quests dungeons or raids together the tank keeps the enemy attacking them the Healer keeps the group alive and the Damage role whether close combat with blades or long range with magic well they damage the enemies the cool thing about a video game is is that you can experiment with the character you play and start over if you don't enjoy it now let'

video game is is that you can experiment with the character you play and start over if you don't enjoy it now let's stop and reflect for a bit are you noticing patterns in the real world how your identity influences your opportunity and potential how getting attached to one specific political religious or social ideology can make it difficult to get

into that state of Maximum enjoyment we will break down the psychology of this soon after you create your character you are thrown into a specific starting zone for that race or that character this is very similar to the culture that you were raised in all you know is one little spot on the map the rest is dark and unknown in reality the culture that you're raised in determines your values and beliefs because that'

re raised in determines your values and beliefs because that's necessary for your survival if you were born in a different spot on the map geographically literally if you were born on the other side of the world your beliefs would probably get you either Outcast or killed especially Western countries going going to the other side of the world there are many such cases of this so just lesson number one is be conscious of other people'

s beliefs and understand that your beliefs are not absolute truth and they are only serving you for the culture that you live in so they're worth questioning what you fail to realize is that you understand less

than .1% of reality if you haven't branched into the unknown and it's very diff I don't think people can ever reach 100% understanding of reality maybe the Masters the select few people but most people the average person that stays in a repetitive routine of tasks and doesn't break out and pursue their own goals they understand and know less than 0.1% of reality and I would argue that number is closer to 0.
1% of reality and I would argue that number is closer to 0.00001% of reality it's not all money girls Lambos and whatever people are chasing to solve their survival needs they have they can'

s not all money girls Lambos and whatever people are chasing to solve their survival needs they have they can't even access their growth needs yet of challenge skill acquisition and understanding the game will not let you progress to new areas of the map until you acquire the skill and ability to level up to the point of being able to survive in those areas as you level up you unlock new quests dungeons special abilities career choices and the ability to ride or fly to New parts of the world you don't need

to understand many more details but this will help us answer a few questions why do we find video games so enjoyable to the point point of addiction is it possible to replicate that enjoyment to make progress toward our own goals in life can we structure our lives like video games so that we become so immersed that we forget we are playing a game in the first place let'

s deconstruct the parts of this Fantastical game to understand the principles that addict our minds the Mind craves order and an ordered mind is a happy mind video games have quests leveling and skill development to narrow your mind on the Big Goal at hand and eliminate distractions video games are designed to make optimal experience easier to achieve quote they have rules that require the learning of skills they set up goals they provide feedback they make control possible they facilitate concentration and involvement by making the activity as distinct as possible from the so-called Paramount reality of everyday

existence the key word there is designed a question I want you to hold in the back of your mind for the rest of this video is how can I design a life month week and day that gives me a sense of control over my life like the tutorial phase leading into quests of a video game Society is designed in a similar way you go to school to make sense of the game Society wants you to play a hierarchy of goals is placed in front of you go to school get a job praise your God at first there is ample challenge to keep

you to play a hierarchy of goals is placed in front of you go to school get a job praise your God at first there is ample challenge to keep the Mind narrow but soon life becomes repetitive and mundane as an aside we'

a job praise your God at first there is ample challenge to keep the Mind narrow but soon life becomes repetitive and mundane as an aside we'll dive into this topic in a another episode but for now feel free to go through my other videos like Society is a pyramid scheme it is human nature to gravitate toward the things that bring us comfort and security but that can turn on us fast the massive problem with the default path in life is that one size doesn'
t fit all we all find enjoyment in different things and what we find enjoyment in evolves as our identity does a level 100 player won't

enjoy a level one challenge a level one player won't understand a level 100 challenge the lesson so far is that video games immerse you so far into the fabricated reality that it becomes your reality it's the only thing that consumes your attention that fills your focus at this point you reach absolute Clarity and there are zero distractions this is the key to maximum enjoyment it's maintaining the sense that one'

s maintaining the sense that one's skills are enough to match the challenge of the situation and you make it easier on yourself to do this when you create an environment or a system that allows your mind to solely focus on that there aren't any problems or distractions that pull you away from putting energy into what it is that you'

t any problems or distractions that pull you away from putting energy into what it is that you're doing now this stresses the importance of having goals that you choose not ones that were assigned to you A big life goal to frame the information that you see as important so you can actually notice that information a series of reversed engineered goals from that to bring Clarity to your actions and a small goal

in the present to rivet your attention in the this very moment and kick you into flow and this is why weird deep work hacks like listening to instrumental music or even putting on a hat or setting a timer or other things those aren't those don't inherently put you into flow but they help you focus your attention so you can get into it easier it'

t those don't inherently put you into flow but they help you focus your attention so you can get into it easier it's an environment that allows you to focus your attention creating deadlines having a hat to literally narrow your eyesight and things like that the mind is a machine that aids in reaching known goals and discovering unknown goals your mind will notice accept or reject and use information to achieve the goals you feed it if you'

re always focused on negative outcomes your life will become negative if you only focus on the goals Society assigns to you you lose a sense of control over your life in Psychology that is called pattern recognition you feel the dopamine when you notice information that helps you achieve your conscious or subconscious goals you can't help but
